@mythmon Currently, our sass is compiled through Webpack and not through a CLI command or anything, so I was looking for a loader or plugin that we could drop in easily. However, in order to add sass linting to the npm run lint script, I'll have to add the stylelint command line tool anyway. I was also hoping that by adding the plugin to webpack, it'd get picked up in watch mode - but, that's not the case.

edit: also, to clarify, the sass lint runs whenever webpack starts up (e.g. npm run watch)

Which reminds me - @rehandalal, currently therapist straight up calls eslint, correct? Could that change so it runs npm run lint instead? That way we can bundle all the lint commands in our package.json and therapist could catch them all.
